1000.name: Introduction to Programming
1000.description: Introduces structured program logic and basic programming concepts, including algorithms, flowcharts, debugging, documentation, and pseudocode. No prior programming experience required.

2000.name: Querying Database
2000.description: Teaches fundamental Transact-SQL skills for Microsoft SQL Server, including writing basic queries and performing core database tasks.

2000.name: Reporting Services
2000.description: Covers the full process of creating and publishing reports using integrated reporting tools. Students learn to design reports, use builders and wizards, and apply data analysis techniques.

2000.name: Computer Programming C
2000.description: Introduces the C programming language through hands-on projects. Covers arrays, pointers, functions, I/O, data structures, and debugging across multiple platforms.

2000.name: Computer Programming C#
2000.description: Covers programming in Microsoft Visual C# with an emphasis on object-oriented concepts such as control structures, methods, arrays, exception handling, and inheritance.

2000.name: Introduction to Database Management
2000.description: Introduces database management concepts, including relational design, modeling, and implementation using SQL. Covers data definition and manipulation, data warehousing, and NoSQL systems.

2000.name: Computer Programming Java
2000.description: Introduces object-oriented programming with Java, covering classes, inheritance, polymorphism, interfaces, and generics. Emphasizes hands-on projects and real-world problem solving.

2000.name: Directed Study in Computer Programming
2000.description: Independent or team projects in computer programming focused on design, development, and implementation under faculty supervision. Content varies and may be repeated for credit.
2000.notes: Requires permission of the Computer Science chairperson.

2000.name: Internship in Computer Programming
2000.description: Provides hands-on experience in a real work environment, emphasizing professional development, problem solving, ethics, and organizational practices.
2000.notes: Requires prior meeting with the Internship Coordinator for registration. Students must complete 80â€“320 field hours based on credit hours (1 credit = 80 hours).

3000.name: Data Structures
3000.description: This course introduces fundamentals of data structures. Topics include: programming strategies, data structures, searching, complexity, queues, sorting, and algorithms. Extensive programming is required.
3000.notes: Also requires COT3100 or MAD2104 (not included in advisor).

4000.name: Operating Systems
4000.description: Covers modern operating system concepts including memory, process, file, and device management, with an overview of system types and administration.

4000.name: Applied Database I
4000.description: Focuses on the design and implementation of database systems emphasizing central administration and structured data storage. Includes a required programming project.

4000.name: Applied Database II
4000.description: Explores relational and advanced database systems, including SQL programming, stored procedures, transactions, and decision support concepts. Programming experience required.

4000.name: Web Systems I
4000.description: Covers client-side web development using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Includes DOM manipulation, accessibility, JSON, and mobile-friendly design through a web project.

4000.name: Web Systems II
4000.description: Focuses on advanced web design using server-side .NET technologies. Students build and deploy database-driven web applications with cloud hosting and full-stack development practices.
